As you may know, one of our 8th grade students died Monday evening. In the days, weeks, and months to come, it is important that we continue to look out for each other. We encourage you to join us in being vigilant, as we help our students cope with this loss; watch for signs of depression, learn more about the risk factors and warning signs for suicide, read stories of hope and recovery, and let our students know that if they are struggling, there is help and there is hope. Students and parents can find helpful information @https://afsp.org/about-suicide/risk-factors-and-warning-signs/, as well as the following:

National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255),
Contact the Crisis Text Line by texting 4HOPE to 741741, or
Go to https://suicidepreventionlifeline.org/ for information or to chat online with a professional.

We will be including additional resources for students and parents on our District website under Parent Resources. Please join our WCS staff in sending our thoughts and prayers to a Hurricane family that has suffered a tremendous loss.

text:
As you may know, one of our 8th grade students died Monday evening. In the days, weeks, and months to come, it is important that we continue to look out for each other. We encourage you to join us in being vigilant, as we help our students cope with this loss; watch for signs of depression, learn more about the risk factors and warning signs for suicide, read stories of hope and recovery, and let our students know that if they are struggling, there is help and there is hope. Students and parents can find helpful information @https://afsp.org/about-suicide/risk-factors-and-warning-signs/, as well as the following:

National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255),
Contact the Crisis Text Line by texting 4HOPE to 741741, or
Go to https://suicidepreventionlifeline.org/ for information or to chat online with a professional.

We will be including additional resources for students and parents on our District website under Parent Resources. Please join our WCS staff in sending our thoughts and prayers to a Hurricane family that has suffered a tremendous loss.

post_text: Elementary Step-up-day was a hit with the kids and staff! On Monday, students who will be attending a different building next year were hosted to a fun-filled morning of scavenger hunts, team building activities, tours, and lunch at their new buildings. Our awesome staff tied shoelaces, read stories, led team-building activites, provided lunch, played tour-guide, and even introduced Sydney the therapy dog. Leading up to this day Principals and Counselors visited students in the different buildings so that the kids could get to know them, students wrote pen-pal letters to same grade students in other buildings, and whole classes participated in Google Hang-outs. Students have been busy meeting new friends and teachers, as well as renewing a few old friendships from other buildings. We're so proud of our WCS students for being open to new traditions and for building community in their new grade level centers.
